intro: Guayania bulbosa, commonly known as the yellow bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its showy, yellow bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories.
